user_request: Write a villanelle about the inevitability of change.
final_poem:
All things must fade, though beauty clings to bloom,  
The moon’s pale face is carved by time’s slow hand,  
Yet in the fall, the seed is never the same.  

All things must fade, though beauty clings to bloom,  
The river bends, yet carries what it knew,  
Yet in the fall, the seed is never the same.  

The moon’s pale face is carved by time’s slow hand,  
The clock’s thin heart beats without a pause,  
Yet in the fall, the seed is never the same.  

All things must fade, though beauty clings to bloom,  
The shadow grows, though light still holds the dawn,  
Yet in the fall, the seed is never the same.  

The clock’s thin heart beats without a pause,  
The season turns, though none can stay the same,  
Yet in the fall, the seed is never the same.  

All things must fade, though beauty clings to bloom,  
The moon’s pale face is carved by time’s slow hand,  
Yet in the fall, the seed is never the same,  
All things must fade, though beauty clings to bloom.

rhyme_analysis.expected_scheme: ABA ABA ABA ABA ABA ABAA
